contentrichtext.text: {{History of Japan|Shoso-in.jpg| Image explanation = [[Shōsōin]]}} {{for|the Super Mario series enemy character by Nintendo|Ninji (Nintendo)}} {{nihongo|'''Ninji'''|仁治|}}, also called '''Jinji,''' was a {{nihongo|[[Japanese era name]]|年号,|''nengō'',|lit. "year name"}} after ''[[En'ō]]'' and before ''[[Kangen]].'' This period spanned the years from August 1240 to January 1243.<ref>Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "''Ninji''" in [http://books.google.com/books?id=p2QnPijAEmEC&pg=PA716&dq= ''Japan encyclopedia'', p. 716;] n.b., Louis-Frédéric is pseudonym of Louis-Frédéric Nussbaum, ''see'' [http://dispatch.opac.ddb.de/DB=4.1/PPN?PPN=128842709 Deutsche Nationalbibliothek Authority File].</ref> The reigning emperors were {{nihongo|[[Emperor Shijō|Shijō]]''-tennō''|四条天皇}} and {{nihongo|[[Emperor Go-Saga|Go-Saga]]''-tennō''|後嵯峨天皇}}.<ref>Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). [http://books.google.com/books?id=18oNAAAAIAAJ&pg=PP9&dq=nipon+o+dai+itsi+ran#PRA1-PA242,M1 ''Annales des empereurs du Japon'', pp. 242-245;] Varley, H. Paul. (1980). ''Jinnō Shōtōki.'' p. 228-231.</ref> ==Change of era== * '''1240''' {{nihongo|''Ninji gannen''|仁治元年}}: The era name was changed to mark an event or a number of events. The previous era ended and a new one commenced in ''En'ō'' 2. ==Events of the ''Ninji'' Era== * '''1242''' (''Ninji 3, 10th day of the 1st month''): In the 10th year of Shijō''-tennō'' 's reign (四条天皇10年), the emperor died suddenly; and despite a dispute over who should follow him as sovereign, contemporary scholars then construed that the succession (''senso'')<ref>Varley, p. 44; a distinct act of ''senso'' is unrecognized prior to [[Emperor Tenji]]; and all sovereigns except [[Empress Jitō|Jitō]], [[Emperor Yōzei|Yōzei]], [[Emperor Go-Toba|Go-Toba]], and [[Emperor Fushimi|Fushimi]] have ''senso'' and ''sokui'' in the same year until the reign of [[Emperor Go-Murakami]].</ref> was received by the second son of former Emperor Tsuchimikado.<ref>Titsingh, [http://books.google.com/books?id=18oNAAAAIAAJ&pg=PP9&dq=nipon+o+dai+itsi+ran#PRA1-PA244,M1 pp. 244-245;] Varley, p. 228.</ref> * '''1242''' (''Ninji 3, 5th month''): Emperor Go-Saga is said to have acceded to the throne (''sokui'').<ref>Titsingh, [http://books.google.com/books?id=18oNAAAAIAAJ&pg=PP9&dq=nipon+o+dai+itsi+ran#PRA1-PA245,M1 p. 245;] Varley, p. 44.</ref> * '''July 14, 1242''' (''Ninji 3, 15th day of the 6th month''): [[Hōjō Yasutoki]] died at age 60. From ''Gennin'' 1, or during 19 years, Yasutoki had been the regent or prime minister (''shikken'') of the Kamakura shogunate. Yasutoki's son, [[Hōjō Tsunetoki]] succeeded him as ''shikken'', but [[Kujō Yoritsune]] himself took charge of the bakufu.<ref>Titsingh, [http://books.google.com/books?id=18oNAAAAIAAJ&pg=PP246&dq=nipon+o+dai+itsi+ran#PRA1-PA246,M1 p. 246.]</ref> ==Notes== {{reflist|1}} ==References== * Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric and Käthe Roth.
